result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shane M Miller in court with attorney Kari Suzanne Hoel.  Defendant Shane M Miller in custody.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
COVERS 14CF172 AND 14CF204.  No corrections to PSI.  Argument by State.  Argument by Attorney Hoel.  Defendant relates.  Court relates and orders:

SW - 5 years Probation concurrent with other sentences
No jail credit
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold
Must not possess or consume controlled substances, unless specifically prescribed to him and taken in the manner prescribed, or drug paraphernalia.
Must submit to random UA testing
Must submit DNA sample and pay surcharge
Court costs

 
Firearm and voting rights warning given.

Defendant Shane M Miller in court with attorney Kari S. Hoel.  Defendant Shane M Miller in custody.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
COVERS 14CF172 AND 14CF204.
Agreement.
14CF172:
Court amends Count 1 to reflect burglary conviction of  Douglas County Case 2006CF68 convicted 09-21-2006 and remaining unreversed.   
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented.
Defendant pleads Guilty to Count 1 of 14CF172 as amended. 
Court question defendant.  Court accepts and finds Guilty to Count 1 as amended.  
Court orders Count 2 DRI.
14CF204:  Court orders all counts DRI.
PSI ordered for both felony files.
Bond Revoked.
Defendant is currently housed at Washburn County Jail.

Plea hearing on November 12, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

This Covers 14CF204 and 14CF172.

Defendant Shane M Miller in court with attorney Kari S Hoel.  Angela L Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
